newsitem.title: ZAIRE: Zaire forces resist rebels north of Kisangani.
newsitem.headline: Zaire forces resist rebels north of Kisangani.

text.p: The Zairean army destroyed a rebel command post and killed 35 rebels in two days of heavy fighting around 80 km (50 miles) north of the strategic city of Kisangani, a Defence Ministry spokesman said on Friday.
The rebels were trying to break through Zairean defences on the road that leads from the town of Bafwasende, the spokesman told Reuters.

"There has been heavy fighting for two days on the road to Bafwasende. The Zairean armed forces destroyed a rebel command post and pushed the rebels back by another 10 km (six miles)," he said. "Among 35 rebels killed were a colonel and a major from the rebel forces."
After the fighting, the army seized 67 crates of mortar shells that had come from North Korea and an unspecified Arab country, he added.
